text: The @AP finds that in three states — Hawaii, Massachusetts and Rhode Island — two-thirds of 2018 statehouse races were uncontested.
author: JoeYerardi

text: GM enjoyed record revenues last year. Cold comfort to the workers at their Lordstown, OH plant who, after 3 rounds of layoffs, saw the last car roll off the assembly line draped in an American flag, their jobs shipped off to Mexico. ⁦⁦@Publici⁩
author: JoeYerardi

text: “Shortly into its route, the (Southwest) Chief passes the single best thing in the United States: a silo in Mendota, Ill., with an 80-by-20-foot ear of corn painted on one side.” This piece is delightful.
author: JoeYerardi

text: Wait! Does this mean that Mountains to Meadows PAC rides again?
author: JoeYerardi

text: This effectively disenfranchises many Native American citizens in states with stringent voter ID laws, as @levinecarrie reported on from North Dakota last October. https://apps.publicintegrity.org/abandoned-in-america/ballot-box-barriers … @Publici
author: JoeYerardi

text: Among the reforms: allowing Native voters to use non-traditional addresses, like the address of a designated building on a reservation, to register to vote. Many voters who live on reservations lack such addresses on their ID cards.
author: JoeYerardi

text: Washington State today enacted voting rights reforms aimed specifically at making it easier for the state's Native American population to vote. https://psmag.com/social-justice/could-washington-state-be-a-model-for-native-voting-rights-reform … via @PacificStand
author: JoeYerardi

text: Powerful, sad story from @ATHolmes and @AndrewRafferty about a potentially life-threatening result of the Trump tax cuts' higher standard deduction: fewer folks donating to charities, limiting the services they can provide to the most vulnerable Americans.
author: JoeYerardi

text: Love investigative reporting? Live and breathe social media? Want to bring the former to new audiences using the latter? If so, join us as @Publici's new audience engagement editor https://publicintegrity.org/about/jobs/#engagement … (Bonus: you get to work with the amazing @meifongwriter and @SameeaKamal.)
author: JoeYerardi

text: Series idea: a weekly ELI5 column where you answer readers’ questions on little-knosn aspects of campaign finance law.
author: JoeYerardi

text: Too bad. It really rolled off the tongue.
author: JoeYerardi

text: Wait. A member of Congress’ leadership PAC is not an “authorized committee?”
author: JoeYerardi

text: Strikes me as similar to the sort of retaliation alleged in lawsuits @mrym_jml found when reporting on alleged racial discrimination at the company: https://publicintegrity.org/workers-rights/workplace-inequities/injustice-at-work/workplace-discrimination-cases/ …
author: JoeYerardi

text: “The sickening thing about it is the people that did this, they raped the land, they took the money and they ran off,” said Morin, with the (Fort Belknap Indian Community) tribal council. “And they stuck the taxpayer with it.”
author: JoeYerardi
